intro.page1Title: The eternal fight between Chaos and Order
intro.page2Part1: Chaos randomly draws chips from the stock and places them as chaotically as possible.
intro.page3Part1: Order tries to arrange the chips placed by Chaos into a horizontal or vertical symmetrical arrangement, so-called palindromes.
intro.page4Part1: Order may slide any placed chip horizontally or vertically through empty cells. Order may also skip its current turn.
intro.page5Part1: Chaos receives points for each chip outside of a Palindrome  ..
intro.page5Part2: ..  which is 20 points per chip in this example, so a total of 40.
intro.page6Part1: Order receives points for each chip that is part of a palindrome...
intro.page6Part2: ... which results in 6 points, since there are two palindromes (green-green and red-green-green-red).
intro.page7Part1: The game is over when all chips have been placed ..
intro.page7Part2: .. and the player with the most points wins.
